title: Tour de France: Cycling's showcase remains heavily sponsored by fossil fuels
subhead: In late June, TotalEnergies and the race organizers announced a partnership beginning in 2026. Seven teams competing are sponsored by companies or states tied to the production of hydrocarbons.

title: In Toulon, a dive into modernism
subhead: 'Aquatic Monuments' (1/6). Throughout the summer, Le Monde brings you to public French pools with exceptional architecture. In Toulon, the Port-Marchand aquatic stadium, built entirely from concrete, glazed tiles and murals, displays a style that is both sleek and colorful.

title: These French villages have no more drinking water. The reason? PFAS pollution
subhead: Nearly 3,500 residents across 16 rural villages have been unable to drink tap water since July 10 due to a record-breaking contamination by PFAS, a group of toxic substances known as 'forever chemicals.'
